abstract.text: Perform arithmetic and logical functions on large integers.
vector or four 32-bit integers, representing a 128-bit signed integer.

Perform arithmetic and logical functions on large integers.

topicSections.title: Shift and Rotate Functions on Big Numbers (from vBigNum.h)
Arithmetic Functions on Big Numbers (from vBigNum.h)

inlineContent.text: All data structures passed to vecLib
be naturally aligned. For example, a 32-bit floating-point value must be aligned to a four-byte boundary. Many routines in vecLib generate exceptions on unaligned data.

vBigNum.h provides arithmetic and logical operations on large integers, which may be 128, 256, 512, or 1024 bits in length. It defines types for these values, and internally processes them as collections of 128-bit vectors.
vBigNum.h defines its own set of data types to represent large integer quantities, such as
for an unsigned, 1024-bit integer. The function names begin with the data type name, followed by the name of the operation. For example,
performs addition of two 128-bit signed integers.

The functions perform logical and arithmetic operations on scalar values that may be 128, 256, 512, or 1024 bits in width.  These values are implemented as structures of one, two, four, or eight 128-bit vectors, and the operations execute on the available vector-processing hardware if possible.
The functions have names that  are compatible with those in vBasicOps.h.
